roleset.name: to make a mess of

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Mr. Dahl , a registered representative in the insurance business , said [0] he `` screwed up '' because he did n't realize [0] he was breaking securities laws .
example.arg: because he did n't realize [0] he was breaking securities laws

example.name: passive
example.text: `` [The highway system]-1 is screwed [*-1] up '' by the earthquake , Mr. Engelken said [0] [*T*-2] .

roleset.note: Frames file for 'screw_up' based on WSJ; adjectival 'screwed_up' based on BOLT-2,3. No Vncls.

example.name: adjectival rel: screwed_up
example.text: I would like to see people who criticize the occupy protestors for not having a plan to fix the already falling system come up with an idea to improve things ... but things are so screwed up it s much easier said than done .

roleset.name: to have (unpleasant) sex with, maybe metaphorically

example.name: Meta-example
example.text: Two of the more common examples of British-American divergence of usage are *PRO* screw and knock up .

roleset.note: Roleset based on usages in ULA-MASC1-rest; adjectival 'screwed' based on BOLT-4,5. No relevant VN entry. Framed by Claire.

example.name: adjectival rel: screwed
example.text: The economy is screwed , we do n't know how to unscrew it , and inflation is about the only tool we 've got to manipulate it .

roleset.name: secure or fasten; attach

example.name: Weird telephone conversation
example.text: you screwed this whole motor suction party on to something

roleset.note: Based on sentences in callhome1. Comparison to tape.01. VN class tape-22.4. No FN class. Framed by Katie.

roleset.name: give someone the shaft; cheat thoroughly

example.name: both args
example.text: Fortunately we have things like the Khan Academy now that are going *-2 to seriously screw those monopolistic selfish bastards over .

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT.
